eligibility.citizenship: No citizenship requirement; institution must be US-based

fit.rationale: Explicit focus on computing + creative practice; real-time systems research is core to program. CAL consensus algorithm is novel computational contribution.
fit.messaging_angle: Emphasize algorithmic innovation (CAL) and open-source dissemination. Frame as 'democratizing real-time performance technology.'
fit.success_profile: University teams with prior NSF funding; cross-disciplinary collaborations (CS + Arts); strong preliminary work

funding_opportunities.notes: Requires US institutional affiliation. Consider partnership with university if independent. High alignment but competitive.

fit.rationale: Strong humanities application possible (performance studies, music scholarship). Must lead with humanities questions, not technology.
fit.messaging_angle: Frame as tool for studying liveness, audience reception, and collective meaning-making in performance. Downplay technical innovation.
fit.success_profile: Humanities faculty; projects with clear scholarly output; public engagement component

funding_opportunities.notes: Individuals can apply. Strong option if unable to secure institutional affiliation for NSF.

fit.rationale: STARTS (Science, Technology, Arts) explicitly seeks work at this intersection. Prize brings visibility + network.
fit.messaging_angle: Lead with artistic vision; emphasize critical engagement with technology; European experimental tradition.
fit.success_profile: Established media artists; projects with strong visual/experiential component; previous exhibitions

funding_opportunities.notes: Prize, not grantâ€”funds existing work, not development. Good for visibility if POC is complete. Deadline is soon!

funding_opportunities.funder: Social Sciences and Humanities Research Council (Canada)

fit.rationale: Digital humanities angle possible but requires social sciences framing. Good for Canadian-based collaborators.
fit.messaging_angle: Frame as research into collective creativity and digital participation in arts contexts.
fit.success_profile: Early-career researchers; interdisciplinary teams; clear methodological rigor

funding_opportunities.notes: Requires Canadian institutional affiliation. Consider if Canadian university partnership available.

eligibility.citizenship: Organization must be established in eligible country

fit.rationale: Strong fit for European collaboration; digital culture is priority area. Requires 3+ country partnership.
fit.messaging_angle: European cultural exchange through technology; democratizing access to live performance innovation.
fit.success_profile: Consortia with 3+ countries; proven track record; clear European dimension

funding_opportunities.notes: Requires 40% co-financing and minimum 3 partner countries. Complex but substantial. Good for Phase 2 after POC.

fit.rationale: Explicit interest in technology + arts intersection. Less academic focus than NSF. Rolling deadline is flexible.
fit.messaging_angle: Community engagement through technology; expanding access to experimental performance.
fit.success_profile: Projects with clear community benefit; innovative use of technology; scalability potential

funding_opportunities.notes: Geographic preference for Knight Foundation communities. Check if your location qualifies.

fit.rationale: General arts funding; technology projects are eligible but not prioritized. Good for UK-based development.
fit.messaging_angle: Digital innovation in live performance; expanding audience engagement in arts.
fit.success_profile: Clear artistic vision; public benefit; realistic timeline and budget

funding_opportunities.notes: Requires England base. Rolling deadline allows flexible planning.

gaps_identified: No non-US, non-EU funding sources identified (consider Australia Council, Japan Foundation)
No private foundation sources beyond Knight (consider Mellon, Ford, Bloomberg)
No residency programs identified (consider Eyebeam, NEW INC, Pioneer Works)
